niagara.physical
Class LocalKey

java.lang.Object
  niagara.physical.LocalKey

public class LocalKey
extends java.lang.Object

Implementation of a MatchTemplate class whose primary purpose is to take a set of xml elements and an XML element and find the element in the set that matchs it.

Method Detail

readXMLMatchTemplate

void readXMLMatchTemplate(java.lang.String tagName,
                          org.w3c.dom.Element matchTempl)
                    throws MTException
Converts a MergeTemplate Element from the DOM MergeTree to an in memory MatchTemplate object Match info contains one entry for each possible tag name of a child of this parent - value of entry is the AtomicKey object for children with that tagName args and structure may be wrong, but need to somehow initialize the

Parameters:
tagName - The tag name of the element to which this match template applies
matchTempl - An XML element containing the match template specifying how to "match" two elements of this type
Throws:
MTException

setTagAsKey

void setTagAsKey()
Creates a default Local Key which is to be used when no match template is provided in the Merge Template. We need this default because we need to be able to create a rooted key value even when a match template wasn't provided

createLocalKeyValue

void createLocalKeyValue(org.w3c.dom.Element elt,
                         java.lang.String tagName,
                         MyStringBuffer localKeyVal)
                   throws ShutdownException
Creates a local key value for an element. Will search the element for key values as described by local key spec in matcher and will create a string for the local key value

Parameters:
elt - The element whose local key should be appended to parent key value
tagName - The tag name to annotate the local key value with, due to support for renaming, this sometimes is not the same as the tag name of the element uugh, this is UGLY - I don't like it
localKeyVal - modifies this object to be the local key val
Throws:
ShutdownException

createLocalKeyValues

public void createLocalKeyValues(org.w3c.dom.Element elt,
                                 java.lang.String tagName,
                                 ArrayStack localKeyValList)
                          throws ShutdownException
Creates a local key value for an element. Will search the element for key values as described by local key spec and will concatenate those to create a local key value string. Allows multiple matches to the local key spec (local key must contain only one path in that case) in this element and returns a stack/array of strings with those values

Parameters:
elt - The element whose local key should be created
tagName - The tag name to annotate the local key value with, due to support for renaming, this sometimes is not the same as the tag name of the element uugh, this is UGLY - I don't like it
localKeyValList - - this objet will be modified to be the stack of local key values - each local key value is an array of objects
Throws:
ShutdownException
